bow: have stunted my newborns development this may be bit dumb but ftm and learning as go my son will be month old tomorrow so far our routine is us hanging out on the couch and me holding him lot to soak up all the newborn snuggles he sleeps lot and when he awake he mainly wants to eat he usually has longer amount of time he awake in the morning to the afternoon and like said usually holding him and nursing him depending on the cues he gives me sometimes ll put him in his swing to get few things done around the house and he ll get fussy about ten to fifteen minutes in so ll pick him up and cuddle and nurse him he gets tummy time and can hold his head up and turn it over really well ve read that you re supposed to talk to them and make funny faces and read to them and stuff and do talk to him and love on him but don really read or play with him because honestly didn really think about doing those things when he this small don really know how to play with him because he not really focusing on anything while he awake he just looks around even when talk to him am stunting his development by not stimulating talking and playing with him more feel like shitty mom for not realizing and doing more things with him from the start you are doing great he only month old just keep doing what you re doing once he starts to focus on things and discovers his hands and how to hold things you will naturally start playing with him more hes only month old you re fine newborns dont really play anyway and talking vs reading book doesnt matter at that age you re doing great no reading to him would hurt but honestly cuddling and affection helps them lot too are you do tummy time that is helpful as well even if it just laying him on your tummy while he on his and letting him try to move his neck and stuff also consider babywearing carrier if you do have one they re great for getting things done with cuddly baby and for motor development tummy time also ftm parent mines mo her pediatrician told us that once shes like 5+ months thats when its important to start doing other things it seriously took me so long to talk to my twin girls also was behind guess on things like tummy time they re years old now will talk your ear off and are waaaaaaayyyyy too smart for their own good sure your baby will be more than fine amp x200b also give yourself break you should refer to yourself as shitty mom struggle with this too and my husband reminds me how much our kids love me and that even when feel like it far from shitty mom you re doing great mama thank you it scary when you read too much online one article said they should be following things with their eyes at this point and it freaked me out because he doesn really focus on anything in particular right now just want him to have everything he needs and not be stunted because didn do more at this age thank you really need to stop reading so much online it just hard to know what to do sometimes because have nothing to compare this to just want my little guy to have all he needs yeh we do tummy time everyday usually tummy to tummy with either me or his dad he really good and holding his head up and turning it over do babywear and he loves it it puts him right to sleep though yeah our pediatrician told me to stay off the internet when my oldest was baby was always worried was going something wrong it gets easier once they get little more active and giving more cues his vision is terrible right now just make your inner voice an outer voice and talk to him now tell him what you are up to that great to hear we had our last pediatrician appointment at two weeks and won go back until he two months should have asked about that last time but just honestly didn really think about it figured cuddles nursing on demand and comfort talking were what he needed until he gained bit more control over limbs and eyes mean really hardly ever put him down and he rarely cries unless he hungry or has pooed just want to do the best can for him but know every parent wants that too no way snuggle that baby soak it all in sounds like you re doing perfect thank you so much it so scary having new baby once you get over anxiety about one thing something else pops in your mind mainly because reading way too much stuff online we all just want to give our little ones the best possible life we can it hard knowing what that is sometimes especially as first time parent definitely need to cut it out it been pretty anxiety inducing which is not good my little guy has been easy to read so far and ve really just been going of what he tells me he needs and he happy baby that great ll definitely start doing that removed thank you definitely soaking it up ve barely put the kid down since he came home lol he ll never be this little and snuggly again had exactly the same worries but just being there with them making them feel loved and their needs meet is all they really need right now everything to him is stimulating sights smells and noise so even speaking to them and holding him is enough my lo is now months old and we are learning how to play as we go along because we are both learning what he likes and what he does his favourite thing right now is me finding anything that russles and make lot of noise that might change tomorrow so do worry you have all the time in the world to play and stimulate your lo just enjoy the new born snuggles because he will be squirmy super smiley ball of fun before you know it remember having the same confusion with my first especially when read about people following an eat play sleep routine was like what play the baby could do anything do worry about it for now you ll notice when your baby starts wanting to look at things and grasp small objects that when was able to add in more fun stuff these are all good things cuddle baby is happy baby you re doing fine momma it has huge benefits and can actually change brain chemistry for the better hi mama my degree is in this field and want to let you know you re perfectly fine for one thing babies all develop at different rates so don worry about that for another as baby naturally grows mentally you ll interact differently it will kind of just happen as it happens as long as you re paying attention to new skills as they develop you ll be able to meet new social and psychological needs and it sounds like you pay good attention don worry whatsoever you ve got this trust your gut after all you grew this little person you absolutely got this thank you this is all so reassuring being first time parent is sort of terrifying lol thank you thank you so much that really great to hear ll definitely start trusting my guy and my baby more he happy little dude and really easy to read as far as his cues and cries go going to cut out reading too many things online too lol the internet is full of lies and fear trust yourself you know him best clearly snuggle that baby rarely left the couch for the first two months and soaked up all the snuggles could nothing got done and for an ocd cleaner like me was surprised didn care you can do things when they re older my month old will no longer sleep in my arms and was worried like you that it would harm her development but nope she loves hugs and kisses and sleeping in her own bed soak it all in congratulations ❤️ aww that wonderful so great to hear am definitely soaking it up clean when his dad wants some snuggle time lol that an awesome idea cleaned so much before baby by the time she came we had one week alone with her and my husband with no cleaning and then visitors and most of what they did was clean and cook and then hubby and got some date nights in it goes so fast and just enjoy it lol no had semi colicky baby for the first weeks or so if he was awake he was either eating or crying no ability to do any kind of enrichment no tummy time nothing he 14 weeks now and has hit almost all his milestones on time what he missing is stuff that can happen anytime between now and weeks from now if you re providing any amount of tummy time talking to singing to anything like that you re ahead of the game as far as can tell one thing we all need to remember is the difference between normal and *normal* babies all do their own thing at their own rate they say it normal for babies to roll over at months but that more an average some babies do it earlier some later and neither is cause for concern and that how it is with every milestone from teething to grasping to crawling to talking so all the guides are really saying the normal average age for things teething is my favorite example it is rare but considered normal for baby to be born with teeth and first teeth can come anytime between birth and one year and be considered normal with nothing to worry about my cousin is dentist and her baby girl didn get her first tooth until the week before her first birthday we found that hilarious we worry so much about providing enrichment and such we never stop and worry about overstimulation though just keep doing what you re doing he ll let you know when he ready for more you re doing great my mom used to act like was ruining my son by cuddling him all day letting him nap on me and not taking him out to socialize with her friends huge eye roll was so worried my tiny sleepy potato wasn interacting enough he just turned and is perfect yours will be too if it makes you feel better had no idea what to say to my two month old but sometimes read *i ll be gone in the dark* out loud to her not like she understood any of what was reading anyway 🤷‍♀️ this was also after we had been discharged from the nicu where the nurses did sort of talk to her but mostly so she got used to their voices while they checked her vitals etc they told me not to worry about trying to narrate my whole day to her when asked seconding this advice got into the habit of narrating simple tasks like changing clothes or my plan to get us ready to go out or retelling the adventures of the day mainly it was for my own sanity but it gave me something to talk to my baby about when didn know what to say it sounds like you re doing amazing you described wonderful first month keep up the great work following things with their eyes has very specific meaning it means that if you take small brightly colored object hold it 12 inches away from their face and move it left to right across their field of vision they try to follow it with their eyes or turn their head it does mean that they will do this every time or even most of the time because they may be tired bored or over stimulated like in this video https www youtube com watch v=ccfzqcje838 amp gl=sg amp hl=en gb the baby just does want to cooperate around min more generally do pay attention to anything you read online unless they ve clearly explained what age range that applies to in particular lot of advice is for months and older but may not work well or is unnecessary for newborn putting down drowsy but awake eat play sleep tummy time on the floor vs on your body or carrier fixed bedtime with routine reading to them etc you are doing great affection and attention is what your baby needs right now but if you want more help to assist with development recommend the wonder weeks it book but you can also get it on an app it gives you predictable developmental milestones and different games and toys you can use to stimulate each developmental leap found it really helpful you got this was worried about this too so started playing audiobooks we just got through the second harry potter one think things will be ok read to my lo since birth but really it was something for me to do she showed no interest lol remember those first couple months thinking what should be doing with this potato think we should be doing something in few months they ll be way more interactive and the fun will start mine is almost months now and what major change from the newborn potato stage my mom made meals and helped clean the first couple weeks it so helpful that awesome you guys got come date nights in hoping we can sneak some in soon you re so right this is great advice thank you my mom has told me spoiling him by holding him so much few times though mostly in joking manner they re only little and want to be held and cuddled for so long and will take full advantage of that thank you do some of that already like singing him diaper change song made up lol definitely going to do more of it though ve really noticed it hard to find advice relating to newborns that are younger than three months just going to stop googling stuff for my own sanity have the app my boy should begin his first leap tomorrow or sometime soon excited for it ve thought about doing that but will for sure now started collecting audiobooks when got pregnant so it ll be perfect thank you for the suggestion ooooo yes good call google is not your friend with my first referred to book from the mayo clinic your baby first year or called my pediatrician when had questions the internet has way too much conflicting information it so true and lot of stuff will say something is totally normal but could also mean something bad it very hard to know what normal when reading that stuff because you re or at least am more inclined to worry and assume the worst best just to call the pediatrician and ask she told us before to not hesitate to call for anything and that she gets all sorts of questions and concerns from first time parents there is one thing that you have said you are doing but ll remind you photos everyday all the time did do it and that one thing really regret my baby is nearing two and so wish had more of those under month pics otherwise you are fine would think so everyone has different parenting styles and as long as he loved and fed say it okay do recommend trying reading though my daughter is almost year and half old and she already helping me read her books not the short baby books but like golden books she starting to speak in short sentences ride the puppy come on poky watch fish movie and can already count to 20 she shouts out random numbers after that and has been able to tell me what she wants since she was around months old started showing alphabet flash cards to her and reading books to her multiple times day from the day brought her home and she loves her abcs and numbers now and it great bonding time ❤️ taking so many pictures and videos everything from him nursing trying to latch on to daddy sucking his pacifier swinging in his swing sleeping just hanging out literally everything can think of to remember these days my so had the idea last night of daily pictures in the same spot to track growth which started today wish had done that from the beginning but definitely have tons of pictures so far he only month old and get sad looking back at how small he was and reminiscing on labor and him being born that so awesome the flash cards are great idea for sure going to start reading to him from now on loved reading as kid and have been excited to read some of my favorite books to him no reason not to start now ll invest in some flash cards too thank you yes did this narrated what was doing and just letting my inner monologue become outer you re doing fine if baby is rolling over already then he is super strong talking is great way to let them know you re still there but there no point making faces he ca see you yet check out infant eyesight charts he still pretty blind my only suggestion would be to try to get him to settle alone for longer you will thank yourself for it later your doing good newborns are called potatoes for reason they just want to sleep and eat if you are worried about his eyes you can get some fairy lights my week old loves ours he was mesmerized the first time he noticed them you re doing great check out some videos by these folks if you want some easy content on child development that grounded in solid research https www youtube com playlist list=pl8tryxj3bbwmo orvmeltbsa6j9sft6v5 think it important to recognize that parenting is not always simply commonsense and that what our own childhoods looked like sets our expectations and comfort for what we do with our own kid it great that you re asking these questions shows you re thoughtful conscientious person keep it up mama that first smile is coming and everything is better after that he smiles and giggles in his sleep and it melts my heart every time can wait until he smiles at us for the first time it is soooo easy to get sucked into panicky hole worrying about what you should be doing as parent but seriously you re doing great snuggles are exactly what baby that age needs it sounds like you re really in tune with your little one honestly you ll probably find you end up naturally doing stuff when the baby starts to need it for example once they start looking around more and engaging with what they see studying your face etc it almost like an instinct to start talking to them and pulling funny faces at them basically feed them keep them clean help them sleep however works and love them that all tummy time on your chest or babywearing is great too floor time is great if they tolerate it but no need to force it until months swing or bouncer is great for few minutes to get something done or eat pee that makes lot of sense didn really know how was going to know what he needed up until now but it does seem like it just happens you really do learn what cry means what just by paying attention to them sounds like you re doing great honestly even though read to her daily form months when we started bedtime routine she did really get into it until 10 11 months and now at 15 months she shouts the words out as read talking to newborns is great but mine was interested in any sort of play until months ve heard some will play from 2ish months but do think many newborns really play she crawled at months and walked at year and speaks about 50 60 words already at 15 months basically developing just as she should you definitely have stunted his development cuddles are just what he needs right now and you most likely will find your parenting evolving and naturally find yourself playing more as he grows from newborn to toddler and beyond yup parental instinct is hell of super power everyone pretty much answered your question already so wanted to mention related phenomenon this happened to me over and over the first year friend mentioned reading to the baby every day and was like oh no we better do that month later another mentioned tummy time and flipped out thinking waited too long and better start and on and on there were so many things didn think to do and was worried that was doing them too late good to have friends and good to keep up online but also go easy on yourself we are all learning as we go
